addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasuro
r
of England.

15 Junij 1590. M
r
Bodeleie to my L./

page.lettertext:
fol.287r
It may please yo
r
L. there are two honest
gentlemen in
London
, bothe of my acquaintance,
M
r
William Gent
, and
M
r
John Chamberlaine
,
w
t
whome I have some buisnes, that doth concerne
their estate, and mine owne very neere.
And because it is a mater of bargaine, and
can not well be concluded, but by mutuall
communication, they are bothe desirous, to make
a voiage unto me. In whiche respect, lest
their passing beyond
e seas, should turne
to their prejudice, I am to pray yo
r
L. very
humbly, to give them
e charge of carieng
hither
e next packet, ether from her
Ma
tie
or from my
LL. of
e Councel
. Yo
r
L. shall
bestowe in so doing a singular favo
r
upon us,
and for
e good demeano
r
of the gentlemen,
because I knowe them very inwardly, I will
pawne my credit in their behalf, as farre
as yo
r
L. shalbe pleased to accept it.
And
so I take my humble leave. From
e
Hage
. Junij 15. A
o
90.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
